### Steps to reproduce

In a *dll-Help.Xml file if a parameter has 2 or more `<maml:para>` blocks, only the 1st is shown in "ShowWindow".

For example, in the module SqlServer version 21.1.18245 `Microsoft.SqlServer.Assessment.Cmdlets.dll`)

In the help xml file the description for the Checkparameter: (`21.1.18245\en\Microsoft.SqlServer.Assessment.Cmdlets.dll-Help`)
```
        <command:parameter required="false" variableLength="true" globbing="false" pipelineInput="False" position="named" aliases="none">
          <maml:name>Check</maml:name>
          <maml:description>
            <maml:para>One or more checks, check IDs, or tags.</maml:para>
            <maml:para>For every check object, Get-SqlAssessmentItem returns that check if it supports the input object.</maml:para>
            <maml:para>For every check ID, Get-SqlAssessmentItem returns the corresponding check if it supports the input object.</maml:para>
            <maml:para>For tags, Get-SqlAssessmentItem returns checks with any of those tags.</maml:para>
          </maml:description>
```

In ShowWindow, only the 1st `<maml:para>` block of text is displayed.

Compare:
```
help Get-SqlAssessmentItem -ShowWindow
```
to 
```
help Get-SqlAssessmentItem -Parameter check
```


multiple `<maml:para>` blocks work fine in cmdlet description.

### Expected behavior

```console
All of the help text for each parameter should be displayed.
Platyps will create help XML files with multiple <maml:para> blocks.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Only the first block is displayed.
```


### Error details

```console
There is no error given.
Silent failure.
```
